title: How 3 Israeli hostages tried to save themselves, only to be killed by their own military
description: The three Israeli hostages were killed by soldiers who hadn’t accounted for the possibility that escaped hostages could be moving around Gaza City.

title: Prague declares day of mourning after historic deadly shooting
description: Prague has declared a day of mourning after a mass shooting at Charles University that left 14 dead and 25 wounded. NBC News' Ali Arouzi reports on what is known about the gunman, as an investigation is ongoing.

title: Turkey rounds up over 300 people suspected of having ISIS links
description: Turkish security forces have rounded up 304 people suspected of having links to the Islamic State militant group in simultaneous raids across the country, the interior minister said.

title: Israeli forces fire tear gas near Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa holy site
description: Israeli security forces fired tear gas near the Al-Aqsa compound in Jerusalem, where Palestinians were gathering for Friday prayers.

title: Squid games on the high seas as U.S. Coast Guard monitors Chinese fishing vessels
description: In the South Pacific Ocean, the U.S. Coast is searching some of the armada of ships fishing for squid.

title: Huge explosion snakes across city as 'Hamas tunnels are destroyed' by Israeli military
description: The Israeli military on Thursday released video said to show a tunnel being blown up by its forces in the Gaza Strip. The IDF claimed to expose "a large network of strategic underground tunnels which connect hideouts and bureaus belonging to Hamas’ senior military and political leadership."

title: Vigil held for victims of the worst mass shooting in the Czech Republic's history
description: People who gathered at a candlelight vigil at Prague's Charles University were trying to make sense of the country's bloodiest mass shooting.

title: Democratic Republic of Congo extends election after first day of violence
description: The president of the Democratic Republic of Congo is facing off against 18 opponents in the presidential election. The country is promising free and fair elections despite fighting in the east, but so far violence and disorganization have caused delays.

title: Cubans express alarm after government announces tough economic measures
description: Cuba announced tough economic measures for 2024 that include raising prices for basic services and cutting subsidies on staples, alarming many in Havana.

title: Palestinian support for ‘armed struggle’ is rising as Gaza death estimate tops 20,000
description: As the death toll in Gaza reached an estimated 20,000 on Thursday, a poll released last week by a leading Palestinian research firm offered a window into how Palestinians in Gaza and the occupied West Bank view the war.

title: 13-year-old Palestinian American was shot by Israeli soldiers and detained, his family says
description: ABU DIS, occupied West Bank — A 13-year-old American Palestinian boy was released from an Israeli prison Wednesday night after he was strip-searched, interrogated and falsely arrested without access to his family or a lawyer, his family said.

title: At least 14 people killed in Prague mass shooting
description: A gunman opened fire on a college campus in Prague, Czech Republic, sending people running for cover and forcing students to crouch on the ledge of a building. At least 14 people were killed. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.
